suncertify.db

Class SubcontractorCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.db.SubcontractorCache

  • public final class SubcontractorCache
extends java.lang.Object
    SubcontractorCache is used to store all contractor objects read from the database file in memory. When the application starts all records are read from disk into this cache stored as Subcontractor objects. The Data class is responsible for creating the cache on start up (and populating as a result of this) and flushing it's contents back to disk when the application terminates either normally or abnormally. The cache is essentially a map, where the key is the subcontractor record number and the value is the subcontractor record object. From a design point of view the purpose of this class is to provide better performance as there is less disk I/O involved. It also guarantees data integrity as we can synchronize directly on the singleton cache object when modifying records. Also as we are not writing to disk in real time we avoid any bad writes say for example if the I/O stream terminates abnormally. The cache does not store any information about where the records are persisted in the database i.e. byte locations, it is purely used to hold subcontractor data. Either way we do not need to keep track of disk location as the cache will be written back to disk in a bulk write manner
    Author:
    Kieran O'Brien
